question: Which of the following does notdescribe traditional Chinese medicine?

answers.text: It is considered biomedicine due to its large pharmaceutical system and the use of pills, tonics, and balms for treating illness.
It makes use of diverse substances from the natural world, which can come from rather exotic sources such as cicada shells, tiger livers, dinosaur bones, and various herbs.
It has a focus on balancing a diverse number of energetic forces in the body and is at times practiced alongside medical approaches to healing.
It relies heavily on TEK and ethnopharmacology practices.
